definition: the same old stuff

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.chinese: 我已聽厭了他老一套的回答。

sentences.english: I've been tired of doing the same thing day after day.
sentences.chinese: 工作天天是老一套，我現在已經煩透了。

sentences.english: I'm tired of his stock reply.
sentences.chinese: 我已聽厭了他“老一套”的回答。

sentences.english: He represents change while Hillary is more of the same.
sentences.chinese: 他代表變革，而希拉里基本上還是老一套。

sentences.english: Even P&G routinely whiffs with product rollouts.
sentences.chinese: 甚至寶潔在它的產品發佈上都是那老一套，令人厭惡。

sentences.english: Women are now no longer encumbered with the same restricting stereotypes they once were.
sentences.chinese: 現在女士不再受曾經老一套限制的阻礙了。

sentences.english: Mash notes were old affairs in their mildest form.
sentences.chinese: 情書都是用最溫柔的形式寫的老一套東西。

sentences.english: This bit of folk wisdom is just totally wrong.
sentences.chinese: 這種老一套的民間智慧完全是錯誤的。

sentences.english: So there you go. "Appropriate and proportionate", as is the British way.
sentences.chinese: 隨你便了，“合理適度”又是大不列顛的老一套了。

definition: different broth but the same old medicine (idiom); a change in name only/a change in form but not in substance
hackneyed/well-worn (phrase etc)/same old story/stereotypical fashion
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
hidebound by convention (idiom)
very old/obsolete/out of date
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
conservative/reactionary
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
old methods/old habits
doctrine/dogma/creed/dogmatic
sequence of movements in martial arts/routine/pattern/standard method
a wooden word-by-word reading
to fall behind the ranks/to be outdated
